author: ryg9705
content:
If you're using docker to run the nodes 127.0.0.1 is not your host machine but the container host. You can refer to "host.docker.internal" as host: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/24319662/from-inside-of-a-docker-container-how-do-i-connect-to-the-localhost-of-the-mach
Will add this to the documentation. I guess this is what people are running into.

Configs for `merge-devnet-3` are up:

Working on tooling and links, expect links soon.

Nethermind + {LH,Teku,Nimbus,Lodestar,Prysm}

author: ajsutton
content:
I'm catching up on the fun of devnet-3 and not entirely sure what the actual canonical chain is.  Current state from what I can see:
- teku+nethermind remains broken because nethermind just keeps returning `SYNCING` forever (same problem we saw on devnet-2)
- teku+geth can sync "a" chain and is producing blocks and attestations. 
- forkmon shows teku+geth to be insync with lighthouse+geth and nimbus+geth, nimbus+nethermind and lodestar+nethermind
- block explorer seems to be following a different chain or just isn't syncing properly and isn't showing the teku+geth blocks.

So I think I believe forkmon and teku+geth is doing ok (there were some failures to produce blocks earlier which I'll try to dig into).
